column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////My friend is a huge fan of Jinya and ordered the Jinya bao first which he devoured in seconds. I started with Asagi on draft
column2: which was cold and nice on this warm day. Our ramen came out soon after
column3: he stuck with the Tonkatsu black with some additions
column4: and I had the Chef's special Tokyo Tonkatsu Ramen. It was soooooo good. Just
column7: broth and noodles were just amazing. Thankfully the waitress didn't judge me for needing a fork. lol We also shared the green tea mochi
column8: which were a simple and refreshing end to our meal.
